doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA/1H25 in line battery housing business expansion in China new PO HKD36 Buy1H25 in line battery housing business expansion_2025-08-28

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 36.00 HKD | Price: 31.08 HKD

Mint reported 1H25 results and hosted a conference call: revenue grew by \(11\%\) YoY / \(2\%\) HoH to RMB12.3bn, in line with BofAe. In 1H25, Europe revenue was up \(51\%\) YoY, driven by strong battery housing (BBU) sales, while China revenue was down \(5\%\) YoY. GPM came in at \(28.3\%\) , down 0.2ppt YoY / down 1ppt HoH, largely in line with BofAe (28.4%). OPEX ratio came in lower than expectation on lower freight expenses, and operating income grew by \(12\%\) YoY / down \(2\%\) HoH, in line with our expectation. Net income was RMB1.3bn, up \(20\%\) YoY / \(2\%\) HoH, in line with BofAe. Looking forward, Mint expects its BBU sales in Europe to reach RMB11.2bn by 2030 (RMB3.2bn in '24).

In 1H25, annualized new business intake came in at RMB8.1bn in 1H25 (vs. RMB6.3bn in 1H24), of which \(69\%\) is from NEV. Management maintains its full year new order guidance at RMB15bn. In 1H25, the company successfully entered the battery housing supply chain of Cherry and obtained battery housing orders from BYD for its NEV projects and Chang'an. The company also got new contract from Toyota Europe for the cooling plate for the first time. For its new businesses, management expects revenue contribution from 2027 onward from eVTOL and humanoid robot components. Mint's robotic component products include smart skin, visor, structural components, joint assemblies, and wireless charging. It has secured new contracts for joint assemblies from a robotic brand.

We raise 2025/26/27E EPS by \(0.4\% /3\% /2\%\) to factor in the 1H25 results and the new growth assumptions. Our new PO is HKD36 (from HKD30), mainly reflecting the updated earnings estimates and the higher target P/E multiple at 12x (previous 10x), as we see stronger revenue growth outlook upon the updated new orders target and new business. We reiterate our Buy rating as we are positive on Mint's new businesses and expect it to deliver sustainable earnings growth in 2025- 27.

Key Metrics \\* For full definitions of iQmethod measures, see page 7.
Autos/Car Manufacturers

Company DescriptionMint, established in 1992, is a leading supplier of exterior auto body parts in China. The company's major businesses include design, manufacturing and sales of auto trims, decorative parts, body structural parts and other auto parts. Mint has built over 40 production facilities in China and overseas. Among its 2024 sales, trims & metal and aluminum parts accounted for \(24\% /21\%\) of total sales while plastic parts, battery housing and others consisted of \(25\% /23\% /6\%\) .

We have a Buy on Minth as 1) we like the company's solid revenue growth, which come from both traditional business (we forecast \(4\%\) in 2025E) and new battery housing business ( \(40\% +\) in 2025E), 2) we expect \(17\%\) earnings CAGR in 2025- 27E, and 3) the product portfolio is expanding from legacy business to various aspects of vehicle electrification and intelligence.
Price to Book Value 1.6x
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
Exhibit 3: Mirth's P&L summary (half year) We expect Mirth's 2025 earnings to grow \(19\%\) YoY
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report

Our PO is HK\$36, based on 12x the sum of 2H25 & 1H26 EPS. We arrive at our target multiple of 12x, based on its historical 2- years average PER. In our view, we see opportunity for the stock to trade above its historical PER, as its new humanoid robot business may trigger the rerating.
Downside risks: increasing trade tariff from China and Mexico to the US market, volatile margin in overseas plants, lower margin in battery housing business, and FX volatility.
